title: AdaKWS: Towards Robust Keyword Spotting with Test-Time Adaptation
author: Yang Xiao (The University of Melbourne), Tianyi Peng (Nanyang Technological University), Yanghao Zhou (National University of Singapore), Rohan Kumar Das (Fortemedia), ...
relevance_why: The focus on robust keyword spotting and test-time adaptation aligns closely with Haohe Liu's interests in speech processing and audio enhancement, particularly in handling noisy environments.
background: Keyword spotting identifies specific spoken keywords from audio input, crucial in areas like virtual assistants that often encounter noise.
contribution: AdaKWS introduces a test-time adaptation method tailored for keyword spotting to enhance performance in noisy environments, achieving improved robustness over existing methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like Tent and ETA primarily focused on entropy minimization and required source data for adaptation, which hindered performance under diverse noise conditions.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work leverages selective entropy minimization and introduces pseudo-keyword consistency for robust feature selection, which improves adaptability without needing source data.

key_innovation: Combines two novel approaches: adjusting model confidence via prediction entropy and identifying stable features through pseudo-keyword consistency, thus enhancing robust keyword spotting.
real_world_impact: This approach can significantly advance applications in noisy environments, strengthening the effectiveness of devices like smart speakers and voice-activated assistants.
limitations: The paper does not explicitly mention any limitations.

new_terms.Test-Time Adaptation (TTA): **Test-Time Adaptation (TTA)** is a technique that enables a model to adjust its parameters during inference to handle domain shifts or noise without retraining on the original dataset.
new_terms.Pseudo-Keyword Consistency (PKC): **Pseudo-Keyword Consistency (PKC)** is a metric that assesses the stability of model predictions by evaluating how consistent the features are when the input is altered, which helps in identifying reliable samples.

open_sourcing: The code will be released in due course.
